title._content: Honoring the Memory of Woodrow Wilson in House Chamber

description._content: Local Accession Number: 2373 Description: Prominent personages of at least four administrations gathered in the chamber of the House of Representatives to pay official tribute to the memory of Woodrow Wilson. Beginning at left: Herbert Hoover, Dr. Hubert Work, Curtis Wilbur, Harry S. New, Harlan F. Stone, John W. Weeks, Andrew W. Mellon, Charles Evans Hughes, President Coolidge, William Howard Taft and Members of the Supreme Court. In second row (right) reading from aisle (left to right): William Jennings Bryan, Robert Lansing, E.T. Heredith, A. Mitchell Palmer, Josephus Daniels, John Barton Payne, Wm. Redfield, William B. Wilson, Joseph Tumulty, all members of Wilson's cabinet (Tumulty secretary). Dr. Edwin A. Alderman, President of UVA, Wilson's college, is speaking. Mrs. Wilson and other close friends were also in attendance. Photographer: Unknown Source: Donated by Mr. and Mrs. Bert Adams Size: 10x8 Medium: Print, Black and White Date: 12-15-1924
